alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 6:28PM EDT until May 15 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Escambia County in northwestern Florida... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 528 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen and additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ferry Pass, Brent, Ensley, Olive and Avondale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
